concepts.name: Slope-Intercept Form of Linear Equations
concepts.description: A linear equation format y = mx + b, where m is the slope and b is the y-intercept, used for graphing and solving problems involving straight lines.

concepts.name: Writing Equations Given Slope and Intercept
concepts.description: Creating equations in slope-intercept form by substituting the slope (m) and y-intercept (b) into the formula y = mx + b.

concepts.name: Writing Equations Given Slope and a Point
concepts.description: Using the slope-intercept form and a specific point on the line to find the equation of the line.

concepts.name: Writing Equations Given Two Points
concepts.description: Finding the slope between two points using the formula m = (y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1), then using one point to find the y-intercept and write the equation.

concepts.name: Point-Slope Form of Linear Equations
concepts.description: A form of linear equations written as y - y1 = m(x - x1), useful when given a point and the slope.

concepts.name: Standard Form of Linear Equations
concepts.description: Linear equations written as Ax + By = C, where A, B, and C are integers, with applications in solving and graphing vertical or horizontal lines.

concepts.name: Equations of Parallel and Perpendicular Lines
concepts.description: Identifying or writing equations for lines with the same slope (parallel) or slopes that are negative reciprocals (perpendicular).

concepts.name: Scatter Plots and Lines of Best Fit
concepts.description: Graphing data points to visualize trends and fitting a line that minimizes the distance to all points, useful for linear regression.

concepts.name: Linear Interpolation and Extrapolation
concepts.description: Estimating unknown values between (interpolation) or outside (extrapolation) given data points using linear equations.

concepts.name: Real-World Applications of Linear Models
concepts.description: Using linear equations and graphs to solve problems involving rates of change, distances, costs, or other real-world scenarios.
